publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4192 Aileen Campbell: Clydesdale Scoffs-up Top Awards—That the Parliament welcomes the continuing recognition of Clydesdale food producers and restaurants across Scotland; congratulates Carmichael Estate Farm Meats of Biggar and Border Biscuits of Lanark, who both scooped top awards for their produce at the Scotland Food and Drink Excellence Awards 2009; notes the success of butchers J H Cairns of Law and Ramsay of Carluke in winning gold awards in the first Cured Meat Product Evaluations for Scottish butchers and Biggar butcher J B Hamilton, who became the West of Scotland 2009 Haggis Champion; considers that not only does the Clydesdale area produce some of the finest foods in Scotland, it also cooks it and congratulates Biggar’s Indian restaurant, Taj Mahal, for making the final of the Scottish Curry Awards 2009, and believes that all these awards are just recognition of the world-class producers and restaurants in Clydesdale.

S3M-4192 Aileen Campbell: Clydesdale Scoffs-up Top Awards—That the Parliament welcomes the continuing recognition of Clydesdale food producers and restaurants across Scotland; congratulates Carmichael Estate Farm Meats of Biggar and Border Biscuits of Lanark, who both scooped top awards for their produce at the Scotland Food and Drink Excellence Awards 2009; notes the success of butchers J H Cairns of Law and Ramsay of Carluke in winning gold awards in the first Cured Meat Product Evaluations for Scottish butchers and Biggar butcher J B Hamilton, who became the West of Scotland 2009 Haggis Champion; considers that not only does the Clydesdale area produce some of the finest foods in Scotland, it also cooks it and congratulates Biggar’s Indian restaurant, Taj Mahal, for making the final of the Scottish Curry Awards 2009, and believes that all these awards are just recognition of the world-class producers and restaurants in Clydesdale. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn*, Rob Gibson*, Stuart McMillan*, Alasdair Allan*, Gil Paterson*, Sandra White*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-4192 Clydesdale Scoffs-up Top Awards (lodged on 20 May 2009) Bob Doris*, Ken Macintosh*, Sarah Boyack*, Christina McKelvie*
